gov.nih.nci.cbiit.cmts.ui.common
Class DefaultSettings

java.lang.Object
  gov.nih.nci.cbiit.cmts.ui.common.DefaultSettings

public class DefaultSettings
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines a list of default settings for GUI Settings.

Since:
CMTS v1.0

getUserInputOfFileFromGUI

public static final java.io.File getUserInputOfFileFromGUI(java.awt.Component parentComponent,
                                                           java.lang.String fileExtension,
                                                           java.lang.String title,
                                                           boolean saveMode,
                                                           boolean checkDuplicate)
Title shall better contain "open" or "save" to indicate whether to open or save.

Parameters:
parentComponent -
fileExtension -
title -
saveMode - if true, it will show a SaveDialog
checkDuplicate - if true, will check if user specified file already exists and will ask for either overwrite or specify another one;
Returns:
The File Object that contains user input; null if user cancelled the input dialog.

setDefaultFeatureForJSplitPane

public static final void setDefaultFeatureForJSplitPane(javax.swing.JSplitPane splitPane)
Currently will setOneTouchExpandable to be true and setDividerSize to be DEFAULT_DIVIDER_SIZE.

Parameters:
splitPane -

reportThrowableToLogAndUI

public static void reportThrowableToLogAndUI(java.lang.Object sender,
                                             java.lang.Throwable t,
                                             java.lang.String alternativeMessageStr,
                                             java.awt.Component parentComponent,
                                             boolean substitute,
                                             boolean supressToUI)
Currently utilize JOptionPane to report any given throwable to UI.

Parameters:
t - the throwable
alternativeMessageStr - if null or empty, just ignore;
parentComponent -
substitute - if true and alternativeMessageStr is not null or empty,, will use alternativeMessageStr for display other than the error message within the Throwable.
supressToUI - if true, the message will not report to UI; otherwise, it will report to UI.

Parameters:
component -
Returns:
null if nothing is found or the given component is null.
